page.title: 05Housing
page.content: All of the houses in the area are either privately owned or privately rented, and there is a mixture of large farm houses and smaller farm cottages, some of which are occupied by people who are not agricultural workers. The most common stone used for building is sandstone, and some of the older houses have been extended and modernised. The area contains part of the Gagie Estate which was originally owned by the Abbey of Arbroath. Gagie House is a large private house built originally by the Guthrie family in 1614. Fire destroyed a large part of it in 1890, when it was restored with Victorian additions.
